meanings.definition: Forming or tending to form a concretion
meanings.sent1: The concretionary rocks in the riverbed were hard and solid.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the concretionary process of mineral formation.
meanings.sent3: The concretionary stones seemed to have a secret meeting at night.
meanings.sent4: Her concretionary ideas slowly solidified into a concrete plan.
meanings.sent5: The concretionary growth of the crystal was mesmerizing to watch.

meanings.definition: Consisting of or resembling a concretion
meanings.sent1: The ancient statue had a concretionary appearance due to years of weathering.
meanings.sent2: The concretionary structure of the fossil made it unique among others.
meanings.sent3: The concretionary clouds in the sky looked like fluffy cotton candy.
meanings.sent4: His concretionary beliefs were deeply rooted in tradition.
meanings.sent5: The concretionary texture of the wall made it feel rough to the touch.
